name: biddlebubbly
text: I hope that graffiti says sex funeral.

name: zefiel
text: It does. Did you recognize the Billy Idol poster AND the framed picture of French Fry?

name: jack
text: I thought it was a picture of Phillipe standing on the drum machine manual, but I like your interpretation better because the first strip is already referenced. A picture of French Fry diversifies allusions to other strips. Good call zefiel.

name: lhmatt
text: http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uuaff71RZ

name: deimosrising
text: A comment left by deimosrising was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by theoddwaffle, Zoltan, Darthemed)

name: xndrew
text: I understand where you're coming from, and usually I would agree with this kind of sentiment. But the author does something here that most others who use this cop-out ending don't, he uses it to intensify the anguish and fear that Phillipe is left with. Instead of using a dream sequence to get out of thinking up an ending, he has used it to make the ending more terrifying.

name: rykan
text: It's a 5 for me because of the ending, I think it works really well, like xndrew says.

name: steev_dayv
text: And it couldn't have ended with Philippe being 15...he is 5.

name: puguglypress
text: In the future, maybe he will be older. But as long as it is The Present, he is 5.

name: astarael
text: Phillipe is Five. Phillipe will always be Five. There is no other way: he is Five.

name: 21echoes
text: but does philippe know that he is always five? if not, he could very well dream himself to be 15

name: ssddr
text: Nachos YES! Also is that supposed to be Pat at the counter?

name: alisonface
text: This one made me sad.

name: centipede_damascus
text:
You watched it.

You can't un-watch it.

name: belgand
text: Actually, I am lead to believe that with modern liquors you can.

name: landowmpg
text: Chubbied for Futurama reference.

text: The last 3 panels make it.

text: teodor's speech at the end overdoes it

name: hikikomori
text: The look on Téodor's face in the next-to-last panel makes it for me.

name: andrew_
text: chudd

text: I gave this one a four because of the Billy Idol poster, as well as what I believe to be a picture of his french fry.

name: cdl146
text: The guy did his homework. There's a lot of allusions to past strips in here.

name: cousinted
text: If you get a chance, check out kthor's other works, dude's got mad style.

text: Definitely.  Red Eye, Black Eye is something fantastic.

name: hendetta
text:
Best guest strip.

"FUCKIN' PASS IT" made its qay into my vocabulary for quite a few days.

name: gormster
text: A comment left by gormster was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by JohnnyLandmine, Ebessan, Paco, estutius, Audhumla, Nictusempra, SotiCoto)

name: jordstar
text: I agree. Kthor is much better than this, in Achewood and elsewhere.

name: rowboat
text: A comment left by rowboat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Ebessan, Paco, Doc_Rostov, ovenface, SotiCoto)

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, aliiis, Wulvaine, Doc_Rostov)

name: fosters
text: I normally like K. Thor's stuff, like pretty much everything on shortandhappy, but this is extremely weak. The punchline even cribs directly from an early Simpsons episode. I'm not saying "boo he stole the idea," he probably had no clue it's been done. I'm just saying if the best idea you can come up with is something that also made it on a mediocre episode of the Simpsons then you're not really pulling off Achewood-level humor.

name: zefiel
text: Achewood, as guest Directed by Larry Clark

name: radishes
text: I love kthor and I love this strip!

name: serf
text: why is our special boy doomed to fattytude?

name: ttagxamm
text: A snapshot from happier days , before it all went to hell at the quarry.

name: presterjohn
text: K Thor Jensen is a good dude but he seems to have a real Roast Beef outlook on life.

name: dumase
text: (because the french fry and billy idol were all in his mind. all just a dream. no i get it.)

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by littlecat, mashisoyo, theplaidknight, Wulvaine, stormagnet)

name: beansdooma
text: is the cashier supposed to be beef

name: orvel
text: This strip would have been fived if not for the third to last panel. Still, a pretty good guest strip.

name: drago25
text: "turn state's evidence" man i love that phrase in anything

name: mattylite
text: Man as if the "it was all a dream" thing was still ever a good idea, with or without irony, the end of this strip did the Scary Movie thing too, all just referencing tons of stuff about achewood without actually making any jokes, insights, emotional appeals, etc.  Boo to that.  Also, strange things are afoot at the Circle K.

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
I just really can't dig too much on this. I mean... Garfield . Eew.

On that note, has anyone read Garfield minus Garfield? Some guys take Garfield out of the strips involving him and Jon, so it ends up being Jon talking to himself and being crazy. Is so good.

name: art-vader
text: It was definitely an improvement. Random Garfield also works. http://www.dougshaw.com/garfield.html

name: paco
text: so did they actually kill the counter guy, or did it just appear that way because of the red slushy from the machine on his head?

name: diggydow
text: The last panel made it decent, although I don't like that the cartoon infers that stuff like Teodor's big party and the drum machine manual never even happened.

name: caseyb3
text: Achewood: documentary of the year

name: evilernieuk
text: I do not like Phillipe wearing a Korn t-shirt.

name: endoftheworld
text: Shit, this strip is like "The Dark Knight Returns" of Achewood.

name: hendetta
text: CHUDD

name: wallabeechamp
text: I love this one! It's such a neat way for a guest to do a new take on the strip. Is this all a dream or does it not count because it's a guest artist and not cannon?

name: hobit
text: ewwwww...

name: deusoma
text: I only just noticed that Old Phillipe's Korn shirt isn't reversed in that mirror.
